com.hdcookbook.grin
Class Director

java.lang.Object
  com.hdcookbook.grin.Director
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericDirector, RyanDirector
public abstract class Director
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a generic facade for the control entity that manages a show. It receives input from triggers embedded in a show, positioning due to trick play, and remote control key events.

A director manages itself by its state. A director also keeps a list of all states, indexed by name. Most of the actual work of the director is done by its states.

A director provides the controler that's needed by a Show so that applications don't need to.

See also the Facade pattern (GoF page 185) and the State pattern (GoF page 305).

Constructor Detail

Director

public Director()
Create a new Director.

Method Detail

setup

protected void setup(int initialState,
                     ChapterManager[] states)
Initialize this director.

Parameters:
initialState - The initial state of the show
states - All states of the show known at initialization time (must include the initial state)

addState

protected void addState(ChapterManager state)
Add a new state (called a "chapter") to the set of states managed by this director. This extends the set passed into the setup method.

getShow

public Show getShow()
Get the show we're managing.

getChapterManager

public ChapterManager getChapterManager(java.lang.String name)
Returns the ChapterManager for a given state. Xlets can override this, but if they do the parameter to the constructor becomes meaningless.

getExtensionsParser

public abstract ExtensionsParser getExtensionsParser()
Give the ExtensionsParser that will parse any new features or commands we've extended the framework with. If no extensions are returned, it's OK to return null.

Returns:
The extensions parser
